heaviest_rainfall.status: 36.8mm of rain was recorded as having fallen on 04 January 2025, marking an exceptional 37.2 hour precipitation event.  At times the rain was falling at 4.6mm per hour.

heaviest_rainrate.status: On 02 September 2025, the rain fell at an exceptional rate, peaking at 27.0mm per hour, the heaviest downpour recorded.  A total of 21.19mm fell over the 15.0 hour storm.

longest_rain.status: The longest rain storm on record lasted 37.2 hours on 04 January 2025 when 36.8mm of rain fell and at one point was falling at 4.6mm per hour.

most_lightning.status: Since 11 April 2025, the day with the most lightning strikes is 07 September 2025 when 23 were seen.

storm.status: The last storm was on 21 September 2025 which lasted for 1 day.

top_10_dry.status: The longest dry period started on 24 April 2025 and lasted for 19 days.

top_10_rainy.status: The longest rainy period started on 30 November 2024 and lasted for 10 days.

cold_snaps.status: At the moment, it is not a cold snap.  This year has seen 6 cold snaps; typically, 3.7 cold snaps happen every year.

extreme.status: The largest temperature difference recorded was 26.7°C on 29 April 2025.  On that date the temperature reached 27.1°C and fell to 0.4°C.

heatwaves.status: Currently, the weather is stable with no heatwaves in progress.  So far, 6 heatwavess have been recorded this year.  The average yearly count is 1.9.

tropical.status: The most recent tropical night was on 18 July 2025 and this has only occurred 62 times since 1973.

average.status: The current average daily wind direction is southerly (188°).  In the UK, a southerly wind usually brings milder, moist air from the Atlantic.

gusts.status: To date, the maximum wind gust recorded is 93.7 mph on 13 October 2012.

run.status: The top recorded wind run is 1737 miles on 21 October 2012.

speed.status: The top recorded wind speed is 93.7 mph on 13 October 2012.

top_10_windy.status: The longest windy period started on 11 October 2012 and lasted for 21 days.

summary.description:
Today, cooler for the feels like temperature (down 3.6°C), outside temperature (down 3.1°C), and inside temperature (down 2.4°C) and more moisture-laden outside humidity (up 6%).

The past week and month had observable variation in dew point temperature (up 51.0°C), feels like temperature (up 56.1°C), outside temperature (up 53.3°C), and cloud levels (down 154 m) when compared to today.

cloud levels.description:
Today’s average cloud levels is 539.0m lower than yesterday, 291.8m higher than the past week, 154.4m higher than the past month.

The cloud levels for yesterday ranged from 1176m to 4770m and averaged 1949.5m, while the past week and month indicated warmer conditions.
cloud levels.summary: The sky’s high clouds will permit plenty of sunshine.

summary.summary: Inside; anticipate mild and comfortable temperatures. Outside; pleasant, mild temperatures. Also, low humidity will be noticeable and near calm conditions. Possible light showers, the sky’s high clouds will permit plenty of sunshine, and very bright daylight. Stable weather patterns due to high pressure.
